Fields.DialogueText: *KABOOM*
Only a few Morganas left! Don't let up just yet!
Worry not, Captain. We'll send these vile beings back from whence they came!
@BATTLE
Captain? Captain?! Where have you gotten--
Argus?
Bah!
*THUD*
Are you all right?!
I'm fine… Could you help me up?
Of course. What was that all about?
Don't sneak up on me like that and we won't have a problem!
Apologies. I thought for sure, by the way you keep tabs on most of the crew, that you of all people could see me coming.
Ugh. Bit of a blind spot, yes.

Fields.MenuText: Is there a reason you're so invested in the goings-on of the crew?

Fields.DialogueText: Being able to prepare for an attack from any angle is what gives me an advantage on the battlefield.
True, but I doubt the recruits aboard this ship are planning a covert assassination.
Still, my mind's eye is so well-trained that it's hard to turn it off sometimes. By the way, your shoe's untied.
How unprofess--!
Made you look.

Fields.MenuText: Can you tell me what's going on aboard the ship right now?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, several people are gathering in the mess hall, a few others are working in the engine room, and one sailor is neglecting their duties chatting away on the deck.
Who's that? I'll be sure to give them a stern…! Oh, right…

Fields.MenuText: Why do you think I've managed to infiltrate your blind spot?

Fields.DialogueText: I couldn't say. Perhaps my mind's eye is trying to protect me from seeing something I couldn't handle. What exactly do you get up to in that office of yours, Captain…?
Anyway, I just wanted to say good work out there as usual. Stop by my quarters when you have a chance, and I'll brief you on our upcoming mission.
Aye-aye!
You wanted to see me, Captain?
Ah yes, please take a seat. I've received word of a our next mission.
Do tell. It will be nice to get up and about again!
I'm sorry to disappoint you, but this may not be the thrill ride you were hoping for. We'll be delivering several new bombers to allied ships at various locations. That's about it.
Wonderful!

Fields.MenuText: Why so excitable?

Fields.DialogueText: It's always fun seeing new planes or ships when delivering equipment! Plus, seeing the looks of those I've helped is compensation enough!

Fields.MenuText: You like helping people that much?

Fields.DialogueText: Most Belles can only aid in the war effort through violence. It's nice to be able to help out in a way only I am capable of.

Fields.MenuText: Have you done any missions like this before?

Fields.DialogueText: I was deployed with the Mediterranean Fleet for contraband control duties in Toulon. While it didn't involve much transportation, I enjoyed helping out as much as I could.
*ALARM*
We shouldn't run into too much danger on the road ahead. You'd best get your fill of Morgana battering in while you can!
Leave it to me, Captain!
@BATTLE
What are you up to, Argus?
In preparation for our upcoming mission, I thought I would start making a list of the necessary equipment we'll need for the journey ahead.
How studious.
Do you have a pen, by any chance? This one has run out.
No, sorry.
Never mind, there's one on the floor below. I can see it lying untouched on someone's desk.
If you like, I'd be happy to go and get it for you.
No need, Captain. I'll be right back.
I still struggle to believe my eyes every time you phase through solid metal...
*ALARM*
Morganas! I trust you can hear the alarm from wherever you are, Argus! Meet me on the deck!
*ALARM*
Next time, try not to go looking for a pen in a hot zone, could you? Most Belles choose not to use their powers so flippantly.
I am not like most Belles, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Do you enjoy terrifying the crew with your supernatural ways?

Fields.DialogueText: I will admit it does have its charms.

Fields.MenuText: Is there anything else you can do?

Fields.DialogueText: I possess the same capabilities as all other Belles - teleportation, phasing through objects, and levitating to name a few. Although... there is one power I have that no other Belle does.
What's that...?
The power to intrigue people with white lies long enough for them to forget why they were scolding me.

Fields.MenuText: Do you use these powers for good or evil?

Fields.DialogueText: If you're asking if I ever spy on you, Captain, you don't need not worry.
Good to know.
What you get up to in the comfort of your quarters between 0245 and 0330 every Saturday night is none of my business.
We should dock soon. As soon as your list is done, we'll head to town and pick up some supplies.
Yes, Captain!
I think we've got everything we need for the journey ahead.
I don't think picking up additional gift baskets to give alongside the bombers was necessary. We're just doing our job, after all.
If we're going to do our job, we might as well do it at 110%!
Though I will forgo the gift basket to myself. That would be overkill, don't you think?
Anyway, our first stop is quite a ways away. Let's head back onto the ship, deal with any Morganas blocking our exit, and set sail as soon as possible.
Yes, Captain!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I'd never tell.
Well, if you're not getting one for *me*.

Fields.DialogueText: Just you wait, my dear!
... I was joking.
I'm not at all sure that that matters.

Fields.MenuText: Moving on...

Fields.DialogueText: Our first stop is quite a ways away. Let's head back onto the ship, deal with any Morganas blocking our exit, and set sail as soon as possible.
Thank you very much. Have a nice day as well!
They seemed pleasantly pleased with our delivery, did they not?
It's nice to be able to help out in ways like this. Sure, toppling Morganas is what gets you medals of honor, but our deliveries keep them in the game!
And I suppose ogling at all these magnificent ships is just a bonus?
That's my reward for a job well done. Look, Captain, isn't this vessel magnificent? The figurehead is just wonderful. I'd love to have something like this.
If you play your cards right, maybe we could pick one out for your birthday or something. I'm just now thinking... do Belles even have birthdays?
I suppose you could count my recommission date as what you humans would refer to as a "birthday". Incidentally, it will coincide with the end of our mission.

Fields.MenuText: Do you plan on celebrating?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, this will only be my second "birthday," as you put it. I haven't given it much thought.

Fields.MenuText: So being restricted by physical matter isn't the only trait of humanity you've disregarded.

Fields.DialogueText: You make it sound like I'm indifferent to humanity's struggle, Captain! I wouldn't fight so valiantly in the war effort if I didn't have love for mankind.
I just don't see why I should pretend to be something I'm not.

Fields.MenuText: We'll have to do something!

Fields.DialogueText: What exactly did you have in mind?
Is there anything you'd like? Aside from a thousand-pound figurehead, of course.
Not particularly.
Come on, there has to be something you'd like.
Don't worry about me, Captain. You should be worried about the fleet of Morganas heading towards this dock.
I don't see any--
*ALARM*
Your foresight will never fail to give me goosebumps...
@BATTLE
We should reach our next destination in a few days. Best take that time to rest up.
Hopefully, all those we meet will be as kind as those from before. I will have to send some of the nicer ones invitations to join our crew.
Do you normally do such a thing?
Mostly with pilots who show potential. That being said, I'm not opposed to taking anyone under my proverbial wing, so to speak.

Fields.MenuText: What will you do with this army of hot-shot pilots?

Fields.DialogueText: Why, create the largest multicultural fleet of airborne aviators the world has ever seen, of course!

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure some of the other carrier Belles won't look too kindly on your monopoly.

Fields.DialogueText: You snooze, you lose!

Fields.MenuText: Do you plan only on gathering already esteemed pilots?

Fields.DialogueText: Actually, I would love to open a pilot-training program where those hot-shots I've collected could train new recruits!
*ALARM*
Morganas! I don't suppose any of your fly-boys could help us out right about now.
We're more than a match for these curs ourselves, Captain!
@BATTLE
We should reach our second stop within the next few hours, Argus.
Thank you for letting me know, Captain. I anticipate plain sailing from now on.
Really? The forecast predicted rain.
Do you see those two gulls up above? They likely wouldn't be flying out so far into the open ocean if rain were imminent. A torrential downpour would leave them nowhere to escape.

Fields.MenuText: How studious. Is it only birds that you use to make such predictions?

Fields.DialogueText: You should clarify, Captain. I study the birds' flight patterns in relation to the sea's movements and the changing of the clouds. Everything in this world is connected.
Is that so?
If I've said it once, I've said it a thousand times: my mind's eye is nothing special. Anyone can see the world for what it is... even predict the future, if they look hard enough.

Fields.MenuText: Do you believe in such bad omens?

Fields.DialogueText: I believe everything happens for a reason. Our job is to court disaster. Signs and portents are the way the gods give us on the ground a head start.

Fields.MenuText: That is, unless, these seagulls have come out here to die.

Fields.DialogueText: How ghastly! In which case a little rain would be more than appropriate, don't you think?
I'll tell the men to enjoy the sunshine, then.
Please do! It will be nothing but clear skies from here on--
*KAKROOM*
*KAKROOM*
Argus...?
That is the FIRST time that has happened. Go figure.
At least things can't get any--
*ALARM*
Tempting fate is a dangerous game, Captain. You are a far braver soul than I!
@BATTLE
Thank you again! These arrived just in time!
No thanks necessary! We're just doing our job!
If there are no complaints, we'll be on our--
Hold it right there!
Is something the matter?
We've been radioing you for the past several hours to see when this shipment was going to come in! Are you hard of hearing on that luxury liner of yours?!
Apologies. We encountered an unexpected storm that knocked out most of our transmission services.
I didn't ask for excuses, I asked for compensation.
Of course. Please accept this gift basket filled with fruit on behalf of our--
Do I look like a man who needs stinkin' fruit? I need cold hard cash! *Smack* Get this fruit out of my face!
*THUD*

Fields.MenuText: You will be paying for that either with money or time behind bars.

Fields.DialogueText: It's okay, Captain. We can always buy more fruit. A new personality... now, that's priceless.

Fields.MenuText: How dare you!

Fields.DialogueText: Stand down, Captain. There is no need to meet this brute where he is.

Fields.MenuText: Argus, are you all right?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm fine, Captain. My fruit, on the other hand, deserved better.
Now, get out of here before I do something I regret.
Didn't you hear me?! I said scram!
I will... after you apologize.
Ha! And what makes you think...
*GLARE*
... Whatever. Sorry about your stinkin' fruit, all right?! I'm going back to work!
*ALARM*
It looks like we are as well, Captain. With me!
Argus...
@BATTLE
That was quite the display back there, Argus. You didn't back down against someone more than twice your size!
Considering enemy Morgana vessels are some hundred times my size, that overblown ape could do little to intimidate me.
Still, I was very impressed you managed to keep your head.
It's expected of someone my age.
You don't look that old to me.
You forget, Captain, there have been ships named "Argus" dating back to as early as 1799. Their resolve and experiences all run through my veins.

Fields.MenuText: Wow, so despite looking twenty-five you're technically... 150? Give or take a decade?

Fields.DialogueText: I hold it well, don't I? The trick is anti-aging cream, twice a day.

Fields.MenuText: Do you remember anything about their lives?

Fields.DialogueText: I often have brief glimpses into their worlds during my dreams. I can say with confidence that I am by far the most stylish Argus there has ever been!

Fields.MenuText: In that case, I can't imagine anything scaring you.

Fields.DialogueText: There is but one creature on this planet that scares me to my core. It's often black, can survive on land or on the sea, and has made it its mission to terrify all those come into contact with it.
Morganas?
No, spiders. I lied about the "surviving on sea" part.
*ALARM*
Morganas! Let's take them out without so much as a wince!
Aye-aye!
@BATTLE
Argus! There you are!
Bah!
*THUD*
How many times must I tell you, Captain! Please refrain from sneak attacks like that...
Should I be flattered that I'm your weakness or concerned that you have one?
I wouldn't use the word "weakness" so loosely, Captain. Were I truly searching for you, I could find you in an instant.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, really?

Fields.DialogueText: After seeing how I operate, you still doubt my abilities?

Fields.MenuText: Care to put your mind's eyes where your mind's mouth is?

Fields.DialogueText: Oho, a challenge? What did you have in mind?

Fields.MenuText: That's terrifying in more ways than one...

Fields.DialogueText: Which is exactly why you should avoid getting on my bad side.
We have some time before reaching our final delivery stop. How about a friendly wager?
I'm listening.
If you truly believe you can find me, let's see you do so after giving me a thirty-second head start to hide.
Interesting... Your terms?
If you win, I will admit your all-seeing eye is second to none. If I win, you have to tell me what kind of present you want for your "birthday."
Hm... Very well. This should be fun!
*ALARM*
I'll start hiding as soon as this battle is over.
@BATTLE
I know I saw the Captain head down here... Where on Earth could...
Ugh! I give up! I've been down here for hours! Captain! Where are--
Hey, Argus.
Bah!
*THUD*
Hiding in the pipes above. Very clever indeed.

Fields.MenuText: It seems your mind's eye really has a soft spot for me.

Fields.DialogueText: My mind's eye is akin to Medusa's snakes, Captain. It's got a mind of its own, tastes of its own... take that as you will.

Fields.MenuText: Ready to admit defeat?

Fields.DialogueText: Not so fast.

Fields.MenuText: You nearly got me.

Fields.DialogueText: Managing to track a Morgana to a specific ocean means nothing if it gets the jump on your first.
I guess that makes me the victor!
I think it's only fair that you try and find me now. If you can't, then we'll call it even.
*ALARM*
Very well. I'll give you thirty seconds to hide after dispatching these Morganas!
@BATTLE
Considering Argus can phase through objects, the lock on my door would do little to deter her from hiding in here.
This is the last place she would think I would think to look for her.
If I was Argus and I didn't want to be found, I would likely phase through something... Or would that be too obvious?
Yes, I'd expect her to be encased in the wardrobe, walls, or any other part of the room, trusting on me to leave frustrated after being unable to find her!
When all the while she was hiding in plain sight! Aha!
Under the desk.
You're too strong for me, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Don't worry about it too much. One in several billion is still pretty good results.

Fields.DialogueText: When you put it like that, it makes me sound arrogant for wanting a monopoly.

Fields.MenuText: Instead of trying to convert me, why don't we work together?

Fields.DialogueText: What a great idea! If I admit to having a blind spot, I can have you be the one to fill it!

Fields.MenuText: So that means...

Fields.DialogueText: I humbly admit defeat.
*ALARM*
Let's handle the Morganas before taking a well-deserved break!
Yes, Captain!
@BATTLE
So, Argus, per our agreement, I believe you were going to tell me what you want most in the world.
If you insist. As you know, Captain, I'm not one to want for much in this world. I derive the most pleasure from seeing new planes, watching the seas, and helping others.
How very modest.
I thought about asking you for a new dress. This one in particular, here in the catalogue.
How many zeroes is that...?
But I know you would prefer to give me something more sentimental, right?
Y-yes...
As I thought. In which case... I would love a new book about Roman and Greek mythology.

Fields.MenuText: Right, you would hold an interest in that, wouldn't you?

Fields.DialogueText: Roman and Greek mythology are my gospel, Captain. I can never have too many sacred texts.

Fields.MenuText: I believe Hermes has quite a few texts at her disposal. Couldn't you ask her?

Fields.DialogueText: If you're familiar with the relationship between the Hermes and Argus of myth... well, that's kind of what we've got going on. It's a non-starter.

Fields.MenuText: I don't know where I'll be able to find something like that.

Fields.DialogueText: Like I said, there really is no need. I just thought I'd be honest, considering you'd likely see through any lies.
I'll try my best.
Don't overexert yourself on my behalf.
*ALARM*
On the behalf of innocent civilians, however, I would encourage you to work up a sweat! Let's go!
@BATTLE
Argus!
Bah!
*THUD*
We should really consider putting down some carpet across the deck if this is to become a recurring theme.
What.... do you want... Captain?
There's a small library at a port up ahead. I thought I would take the time to pick out a book for you.
That's very thoughtful. Perhaps you could pick up some painkillers as well...

Fields.MenuText: Are there any specific parts of mythology that appeal to you?
Which do you prefer, Roman or Greek mythology?

Fields.DialogueText: That's like asking me to choose my favourite child! In which case, I would choose the one with the most attractive goddess; that being Hera.
The shrine to Hera in my room should tell you all you need to know on that front.

Fields.MenuText: Perhaps you could come with me to pick one out?

Fields.DialogueText: That defeats the purpose of a gift, does it not? I give gift baskets confident that the recipients will enjoy them. Believe in yourself, Captain, and the rest will come naturally.
*ALARM*
Morganas! This will be the final stop before our last delivery, so be sure to make the most out of it!
@BATTLE
That should all be in order.
Thank you very much. This came just in time!
If that's all, we'll be off!
Oh, Captain... I believe you had some things to discuss with us? You radioed ahead and--
Yes, yes! No need to talk about that here. Argus, why don't you go and pick up any supplies we need?
Did you bring the money, Captain? We can't do this if you don't have at least--
Would you just--! Go on, Argus. Handle the supplies and then deal with any Morganas.
Aye-aye, Captain...
@BATTLE
Captain, can we have a word?
I'm surprised you managed to find me, Argus. Usually it's me tracking you down.
Fancy that.
Something on your mind?
What happened yesterday? After we finished our final delivery.
... I'm sure I have no idea what you're talking about.
I'm no fool, Captain. I saw you exchanging money with those men. You were awfully defensive when I tried to confront you.

Fields.MenuText: It must be your imagination.
I was tipping them!

Fields.DialogueText: This isn't a hotel, Captain. This is no place to start dishing out tips.
I wish it was.

Fields.MenuText: You should mind your own business.

Fields.DialogueText: The goings-on of all those who sail with me IS my business.
I see everything, Captain, so there is no point trying to deny it. I don't want to believe that you are involved in some kind of shady deal, but--
Enough. I told you you must have been seeing things. That will do for today.
Captain, if something is troubling you, let me help--!
*ALARM*
Hadn't you better see to that?
Yes, Captain...
Phew! That was close.
*THUD*
It's going to take a lot of effort to keep this cake hidden from her prying eyes... Only a few days left until we reach the shore and complete our mission. I'm going to need all the luck I can get.
@BATTLE
The Captain will be approaching me in 3, 2, 1...
Argus!
Hello, Captain.
I just wanted to offer you my thanks again for your good work on our mission. I've just received word that there have been no problems with any of our deliveries.
That is good to hear.

Fields.MenuText: You look down.
What's wrong?
We should reach shore in a few days.

Fields.DialogueText: It will be nice to stretch my land legs again...
Nothing... nothing at all... I'm fine.
It is always dangerous when a woman says nothing is wrong. Doubly so when she follows it up with "I'm fine."
You see right through me, don't you, Captain...
It must be your imagination...
*Gulp*
*ALARM*
Morganas! I'd best go deal with them. You look like you need some rest, so we'll handle this.
I am more than capable of helping out with--
No, no, I insist! Don't follow me.
Oh, Captain... I wouldn't dream of it...
@BATTLE
Everything looks to be in order down here... I guess you can stop following me now, can't you?
How long have you known?
Your intimidating glare is enough to send shivers up anyone's spine.
Captain, I really think we need to clear the air about--
Argus, do you trust me?
I did... Now I'm not so sure.

Fields.MenuText: How did you even manage to find me down here?

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe I was able to track you down here because I know where my blind spot is. Maybe I'm learning to keep you out of it.

Fields.MenuText: Then you should trust that I know what's best.

Fields.DialogueText: Have you ever known me to be so laissez-faire?

Fields.MenuText: What can I do to win your trust?

Fields.DialogueText: All I ask is that you're honest with me. It seems you can't even do that.
*ALARM*
I will get that answer, Captain. You of all people won't be the black mark tarnishing my perfect record of good deeds.
@BATTLE
Captain...
Argus. I'm glad to see you're giving me the time of...
I see everything, Captain. You know that about me, don't you?
I do.
Can you imagine how frustrating it must be for someone who sees everything to be kept in the dark?

Fields.MenuText: That sword looks mighty sharp...

Fields.DialogueText: That's probably because I just got finished sharpening it.

Fields.MenuText: You didn't get this angry whenever I surprised you before?

Fields.DialogueText: That was when I thought we were allies.

Fields.MenuText: Very?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes... Very...
If you prefer, we can terminate whatever kind of relationship we had. Strictly business from now on!
And watch you throw your life away with some illegal dealings? I can't sit by and watch as someone I care about silently cries out for me to save them.
What do you intend to do?
I can't do much until I know what's going on. So, first and foremost, I intend to make you talk...
*WHIPCRACK*
By any means necessary.
*ALARM*
What about the Morganas...?
I tell you what. I'll give you a thirty-second head start to hide.
@BATTLE
Did we have a sparring match assigned for today?
You've brought your whip sword.
Then I'm coming for you.
*CRASH* *WHIPCRACK*
*PANT PANT* Argus, please! *PANT* I promise I'm not involved with any kind of mobsters!
Then stop running and let's talk about it!

Fields.MenuText: If I stop I fear I'll be decapitated!

Fields.DialogueText: Please, Captain, you'll be lightly maimed at best!

Fields.MenuText: Have you calmed down?

Fields.DialogueText: I've been calm, Captain. Why don't you come and check my pulse to confirm for yourself!

Fields.MenuText: Just trust me!

Fields.DialogueText: Trust is earned, Captain! If you're honest with me, you have nothing to fear!
She just won't quit! It looks like we'll have to move this party up ahead of schedule. I just need to make it to the bridge to alert the others to bring out the cake!
*ALARM*
Perfect! You don't plan on letting your beloved crew fight alone, do you?
Curse my sense of moral obligation. You win this round, Captain. But I'll be back!
@BATTLE
That deals with all the Morganas. Now, where is the--
*POP* *POP*
Happy christening day!
Captain...
I tell you what, Argus, I will never try and surprise you with anything again. It is far more trouble than it's worth.
Cake...? Party poppers...? What is all this?
It's a surprise party! For you! I thought it was a little sad you'd never celebrated anything before, and it's tradition that the birthday girl is unaware of the entire thing!
I can't believe it.

Fields.MenuText: Argus... You've gone bright red.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course I have! This is so embarrassing! How could I not see ANY of this coming? Me?!

Fields.MenuText: Do you like it?

Fields.DialogueText: I can't believe I, ME, had no idea about any of this. I absolutely-- Is it chocolate?
It is.
Love it, Captain! I love it.

Fields.MenuText: How about we put the sword away now?

Fields.DialogueText: How else do you propose we cut the cake?
*ALARM*
Let's deal with the Morganas and dig in!
Aye-aye!
@BATTLE
Everyone looks to be enjoying the cake and having a wonderful time.
That they do. Oh, I almost forgot. This is for you.
What is it?

Fields.MenuText: Like you don't already know.

Fields.DialogueText: I have full view of the ship, Captain. It doesn't mean I can see through objects. You might want to talk to someone about your gallbladder, though.

Fields.MenuText: Just open it.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. I wouldn't want to spoil the surprise, after all.

Fields.MenuText: It's what you asked for.

Fields.DialogueText: You don't mean...
*ALARM*
Allow me to deal with the Morganas first. I want no distractions for something this special!
@BATTLE
*RIP* *RIP* *TEAR*
Oh, Captain...
Is that the kind of book you were looking for? I wasn't sure.
It's perfect. I'm sorry for ever doubt--
Say no more about it. I won't try to take advantage of your blind spot again. Instead, I'll make sure to help out by occupying it as much as possible.
You've outdone yourself, Captain. I wonder how you plan to top it next year.

Fields.MenuText: How about that dress you were talking about?
I have to do this again next year?

Fields.DialogueText: You were the one who insisted I give human traditions a try. Don't most people celebrate their birthdays every year?
The good news is that you have a year to start saving!

Fields.MenuText: Whatever I do, I'll be sure to tell you about it WEEKS in advance...

Fields.DialogueText: That's probably for the best...
*ALARM*
Morganas! Shall we, Argus?
I'll take the lead, Captain. I trust you can look out for my six?
With pleasure!
@BATTLE
Captain? I'm currently in talks with several of the men we met on our journey.
And?
Some of them showed a lot of potential and intrigue about joining us. How would you feel about expanding our team?

Fields.MenuText: The more the merrier!
I think we have enough mouths to feed.

Fields.DialogueText: That's unfortunate. Some of them seemed very eager. Regardless, I'll let them know.
Wonderful! I'll put the word through now!
*ALARM*
Don't rush yourself. We're already more than a match for any Morganas!
@BATTLE
Argus, Morganas approaching from your flank!
Ah! Thanks a lot, Captain! What would I do without you?
@BATTLE
Phew! We should have some time to ourselves for a short while at least.

Fields.MenuText: Have you started reading the book yet?
Do you have any cake left?
Any bad omens approaching we should be wary of?

Fields.DialogueText: I have, and it's thoroughly captivating! I can barely put it down!
What do you think, Captain?
If my methods are correct, I would say we're in for sunny skies. But in the interest of not tempting fate, I'll reserve judgment.
I wanted to thank you again, Argus.
For what?
Well, if I had been getting involved with the wrong crowd, you decided to try and help me see the light instead of instantly reporting me.
Well... I care a lot about you...
And I thank you for it. Now, if that's all--
Captain... It's rude to keep a lady waiting. Aren't there some feelings you've yet to recriprocate?

Fields.MenuText: I'll always have your back.
I'll always be there to fill your hole.

Fields.DialogueText: You are talking about my blind spot, right?
*Casual whistling*
Captain! Come back here!
And I yours!
